intro: Resedella dipetala, commonly known as the two-petaled resedella, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in dense undergrowth. Its two-petaled flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Due to habitat loss, Resedella dipetala is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
